I am a Sales and Solutions Engineering professional with over 7+ years of experiece in working across the fields of software engineering, data science and technical sales.
When I am not sitting in front of a computer, I am trying out a new recipe, exploring a new city or reading a good book(you can find my reading list here!)

Experience
I am currently working as a Senior Solutions Engineer at Posit. Prior to that, I have worked as a Data Science consultant for various fortune 500 companies.
I have used SQL, R and Python widely throughout my career. I also have extensive familiarity with DevOps technologies like Ansible, Terraform, Kubernetes and Helm.

title: Talks
text: Under the heading Custom Layouts the Quarto documentation also explains a more general approach: Instead of using layout-ncol or layout_nrow where all columns are of the same size, you can also create more complex designs with the layout attribute. In the example of the OP the first column has more text than the second column, so we could for instance to specify a column distribution of 2:1.
